Question: find duplicates in a sorted linkedlist in O(n) time: :What is the most efficient way do this? Is using iterator ok?public class FindDuplicates {    public static void main(String arg[]){        int[] str={1 , 2 , 3 ,4  ,5 ,3 ,5 , 4,3,43,1,33,4,5};        List<Integer> list = new LinkedList<Integer>();        for(int x : str) {               list.add(x);            }        Collections.sort(list);        System.out.println(list);        Iterator<Integer> it = list.listIterator();          while(it.hasNext() && it.next() != null) {             /*   Pseudocode =>   if(it.next().equals(it.next.next)); */            /* OR Pseudocode =>  if(it.next() == it.next().next) */             System.out.println(it) ;        }    }}
